text: Sheldon Stanley Cohen (June 28, 1927 – September 4, 2018) was an American attorney who served as the Commissioner of Internal Revenue from 1965 to 1969. ==Background== Cohen was born in Washington, D.C. and went to the District of Columbia public schools. He served in the United States Navy during World War II. He received his law degree from the George Washington University Law School and practiced law in Washington, D.C. He was involved with the Democratic Party and served as the general counsel to the Democratic National Committee.Sheldon Cohen-obituary ==Death== He died of heart failure on September 4, 2018, in Chevy Chase, Maryland at age 91. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Lawyers from Washington, D.C. Category:Military personnel from Washington, D.C. Category:George Washington University Law School alumni Category:Commissioners of Internal Revenue Category:Maryland Democrats
title: Sheldon S. Cohen
